result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacey L Kline was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the jail sentences are to be consecutive to each other and consecutive to any other sentence.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.

miscConds.notes: Cash Bond of $350.00 applied to the court costs.

-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Take all prescriptions as prescribed.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacey L Kline

records.addlTxt: Discharge, Regular - 10/11/2018

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Releasing Funds - $350.00 to Clerk of Courts

3:01 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to:  2015CF98 - Count 1, Count 2 amended to Carrying concealed weapon, Count 3 & Count 5 and on 2015CM97 - will plea to count 1.  State concurs.  Atty Roeth concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged, count 2 as amended, counts 3 & 5 as charged on 2015CF98.  Court orders counts 4 & 6 on 2015CF98 be dismissed and read-in.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged on 2015CM97.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

2015CF98
Count 1

-10 days county jail
-$400 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DL revocation - 13 months
-IID - 13 months
-AODA (GL)
-Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
-DNA Sample.

COUNT 2

120 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:
-Court costs.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Take all prescriptions as prescribed.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

COUNT 3

120 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:
-Court costs.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Take all prescriptions as prescribed.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

COUNT 5

-20 days county jail.
-Court costs.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2015CM97

COUNT 1

120 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:
-Court costs.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Take all prescriptions as prescribed.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court orders the jail sentences to be consecutive to each other and consecutive to any other sentence.  To commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out of county travel and out of county service.

Court grants one day of sentence credit on the OWI.

Court adjourned at 3:20 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 11, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Court adjourned at 2:36 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 30, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
